workflow.name: Manage Trello tasks with AI assistants via MCP server
workflow.description:
A lean MCP Server that exposes the essential Trello tools for everyday task management. Built for clean, reliable LLM automation with n8n, ChatGPT, or Gemini.

# Description  
A minimal MCP Server offering the core Trello operations‚Äîcreate, update, search, list, and comment‚Äîdesigned to keep task management simple and predictable.  
Each tool has a clear, LLM-friendly schema, ensuring safe automation without heavy context or complex payloads.

Use it to create tasks, move cards between lists, update details, add comments, or retrieve board structure. All through natural language.

---

# ‚≠ê Key Features

- **Lean Toolset** ‚Äì only the operations needed for real task flows  
- **LLM-Ready** ‚Äì minimal, explicit parameters for safe execution  
- **Extendable** ‚Äì add more Trello endpoints or custom logic easily  
- **Predictable Updates** ‚Äì partial updates with safe defaults  
- **MCP + Tool Calling** ‚Äì works in n8n Agents, ChatGPT, Gemini, and MCP clients  

---

# üß† Examples (Natural Language)

**‚ÄúWhat tasks do I still have pending from last week?‚Äù**  
‚Üí Searches by due date and status for weekly planning.

**‚ÄúMove all tasks due yesterday into today‚Äôs list and add a ‚Äòrescheduled‚Äô comment.‚Äù**  
‚Üí Combines search + update + comment.

**‚ÄúCreate a new card called ‚ÄòPrepare onboarding materials‚Äô for next Monday.‚Äù**  
‚Üí Simple card creation with due date handling.

---

# ‚öôÔ∏è How It Works

This MCP Server exposes 6 core tools:

### üì• Create Card  
Create tasks with title, description, and optional due date.

### üîç Search Cards  
Find cards using Trello‚Äôs native search syntax (keywords, lists, due filters).

### üóÇ List Backlog & List All Lists  
Provide structure and situational awareness for agents.

### ‚úèÔ∏è Update Card  
Rename, update description, adjust due dates, or move cards.

### üí¨ Add Comment  
Add quick notes to any card without modifying other fields.

---

# üîê Required Credentials

| Service | Use |
|--------|-----|
| Trello API | API Key + Token for card, list, search, and comment operations |

Use a dedicated Trello automation token for clean audit logs.
Please check [Authorizing With Trello's REST API](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/trello/guides/rest-api/authorization/)

---

# üß∞ Customization Tips

- Replace board/list IDs with your own  
- Add labels, checklists, or custom fields if needed  
- Add domain logic (priority rules, conventions, or workflows)  
- Use `list_all_lists` in agents to give LLMs workflow awareness  

---

# üß† Who It‚Äôs For

- Automation builders exploring MCP  
- AI assistants for personal task planning  
- Teams with simple Trello workflows  
- Consultants building lightweight agents  

---

# üöÄ Try It Out

1) Import the MCP workflow into n8n  
2) Add your Trello API credentials  
3) Replace IDs with your board/list values  
4) Test with ChatGPT or Gemini via natural-language prompts  
5) (Optional) Register it as an MCP Server in VS Code or any MCP client  

---

# üí¨ Feedback Welcome

This MCP Server is intentionally simple and extendable.  
If you adapt or evolve it, I‚Äôd love to hear your ideas.

üìß [ascuncia.es@gmail.com](mailto:ascuncia.es+n8ncreator@gmail.com)

parameters.toolDescription:
Create a new card in a Trello list.

Params (strings):
- card_name (required) ‚Üí card title
- card_description (optional)
- Due_Date (optional, ISO-8601)

Behavior:
- Use when the user wants to add a task, note, or reminder.
- Due_Date can be empty.
- This tool only creates cards; it does not update, move, or delete them.

List all cards from a specific Trello list.

Params:
- None.

Behavior:
- Returns all cards with id, name, desc, due, labels, members.
- Read-only.

List all lists on the Trello board.

Params:
- None.

Behavior:
- Returns id + name for each list.
- Read-only.

Search Trello cards by text and/or due date.

Params:
- Query (required)

Behavior:
- Uses Trello native search syntax.
- Returns matching cards.
- If none match, return [].

Update a Trello card via the Trello API.

Params (strings):
- Card_ID (required)
- New_Name
- New_Description
- New_Due
- New_List_ID

Behavior:
- Only updates provided fields.
- Fields left empty remain unchanged.
- Can rename, update description, move card, change due date.

Add a comment to a Trello card.

Params (strings):
- Card_ID (required)
- Comment_Text (required)

Behavior:
- Adds a note/comment.
- Does not update card fields.

parameters.content:
## üß© Workflow Overview ‚Äì Trello MCP

- Exposes Trello actions as MCP tools.  
- LLMs can create, update, move, comment, and search cards.  
- Lightweight setup for everyday task management.  
- Easy to extend with more Trello endpoints.

## üîó MCP Server Trigger

- Makes Trello tools available to n8n Agents and LLMs 
- Entry point for all AI-driven interactions.

## üìù Create Card
- Creates a new card in a target list.  
- Supports title, description, and due date.  
- Ideal for tasks, notes, and quick reminders.

## üìÇ List Backlog
- Returns all cards from the Backlog list (fixed)
- Great for reviews and planning.  
- Read-only operation.

## üóÇ  List Board Lists
- Lists all Trello board columns.  
- Helps LLMs understand workflow states.  
- Read-only discovery step.

## üîç Search Cards
- Uses Trello‚Äôs native search syntax.  
- Finds cards by keywords, due dates, 
or list filters.  
- Returns matching cards with details.

## ‚úèÔ∏è Update Card
- Updates name, description, due date, or list.  
- Only applies fields explicitly provided.  
- Used for transitions and focused edits.

## üí¨ Add Comment
- Adds a comment to an existing card.  
- Useful for quick updates or clarifications.  
- No other fields are changed.
